Q&A.question: What are the synthesis conditions for Cu2[(O3PC2H4PO3)(H2O)2]?
Q&A.answer: 1,2-ethylenebis(phosphonic acid) was mixed with CuSO4·5H2O in deionized distilled water and heated at 60 °C for 4 days.

Q&A.question: What is the space group of Zn2[(O3PC3H6PO3)]?
Q&A.answer: The space group of Zn2[(O3PC3H6PO3)] is Pna21.

Q&A.question: How does the coordination geometry of copper atoms in compounds 1 and 2 compare?
Q&A.answer: The coordination geometry of the copper atoms in compounds 1 and 2 can be described as distorted square-pyramidal, but the distortion is severe in the case of compound 2.

Q&A.question: True or False: The zinc atoms in zinc ethylenebis(phosphonate) have distorted octahedral geometry.
What is the role of water molecules in the structure of Cu2[(O3PC3H6PO3)(H2O)2]·H2O?
Q&A.answer: The water molecules are involved in hydrogen bonding interactions, linking adjacent inorganic layers in addition to cross-links by the organic moieties.

Q&A.question: True or False: Zn2[(O3PC2H4PO3)(H2O)2] and Zn2[(O3PC3H6PO3)] have the same space group.
What distinguishes the structure of Zn2[(O3PC3H6PO3)] from other zinc phosphonate compounds?
Q&A.answer: Zn2[(O3PC3H6PO3)] does not contain any water molecules either in the metal coordination sphere or in the lattice, and the Zn atoms are tetrahedrally coordinated.

Q&A.question: True or False: The interlamellar separation is the same for copper ethylenebis(phosphonate) and zinc ethylenebis(phosphonate).
What is the significance of the lattice water molecule in the structure of Cu2[(O3PC3H6PO3)(H2O)2]·H2O?
Q&A.answer: The lattice water molecule, located in between adjacent alkylene groups, could potentially create a cavity of diameter about 6-7 Å in the interlayer space if removed.

Q&A.question: True or False: The dehydration of Cu2[(O3PC3H6PO3)(H2O)2]·H2O results in a decrease in interlayer separation.
